item.title: Christian
item.description:
I’m a Christian, which means I believe in a Savior and Messiah who was born miraculously, lived perfectly, gave His life selflessly, and resurrected divinely so that there’s hope in this life for all of us. He was the perfect example of how to treat everyone with kindness, respect, and decency. He also taught his students how to think deeply, lead unconventionally, and live life with selfless purpose. His life is filled with a richness worth studying.

item.title: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
item.description:
The church I’ve been a part of since the early nineties.

It’s a Christian church (notice Christ in the name), sometimes referred to as “the Mormon church”, because we have a powerful book called The Book of Mormon: Another Testament of Jesus Christ, which is compiled by an ancient prophet named Mormon. (Like the book of Matthew, or John, it’s named after the author.)

I’m baptized, I’m an ordained deacon, priest, and elder, I’ve graduated from a four year seminary, and spent two years as a missionary (my mission).

item.title: my mission
item.description:
I spent two years in Honduras as a representative for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

I traveled. I spoke in Spanish. I learned the deepest heartaches of humanity in the most impoverished and destitute areas on earth.

Regardless of pains suffered: robbery, infidelity, malnourishment and much more - I saw many healed by The Miracles of Christ.
